results.title: Children of change
results.creator_credit: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Irving Jacoby and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: This film shows the Day Care Centres as developed in Philadelphia where the children of working mothers are looked after. A trained social worker interviews parents and co-ordinates the activities of the centre with those of the home. Provision is made for older children after school hours. Some young children are placed with selected private families. Discusses reasons why women go out to work.

results.title: Children of Brunei
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson, Radio Television Brunei and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: The film shows the life of two children in Brunei at school, reading the Koran, working at the markets, fishing and attending a wedding procession, emphasising the Muslim observance of religious ceremonies. Brunei is one of the last remaining monarchies in the world. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Children of Bangkok
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Thanan Soongnarata, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
The film follows three Bangkok boys, from different economic classes through a typical day. One boy is the son of an Army colonel in the upper middle class, the second, the son of a middle-class shopkeeper and the third, the son of a lower class migrant farm worker. The film shows a cross section of life in Bangkok.

results.title: Children of alcohol
results.creator_credit: Gil Cardinal, Anne Wheeler, Tom Radford and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This documentary focuses on children of alcoholics. In the relaxed environment of a mountain campsite, a group of young people discuss their anger and frustration, and talk about their struggle to cope with the problems created by their parents’ drinking. By sharing their experiences, they open a door for others like them. Aimed primarily at an audience of elementary school children and older, Children of Alcohol will provide an excellent vehicle for generating discussion about alcohol abuse and the family.

results.title: Children of a lesser god
results.creator_credit: Randa Haines, Patrick Palmer, Burt Sugarman and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Mark Medoff’s Tony Award-winning (1980) play. It is a touching and poignant love story between a deaf woman and a hearing man. William Hurt gives a sensitive performance as James a likeable schoolmaster, whose job is to teach hearing impaired people to speak. Sarah (Marlee Matlin - who is hearing impaired in real life) is a young beautiful girl who leaves school with a chip on her shoulder and with the knowledge that sex needs no conversation. The touching portrayal of their attraction makes it impossible not to share the experience. Matlin won the 1987 Academy Award for Best Actress with nominations for Best Picture, Best Actor, Best Supporting Actress and Best Adapted Screenplay.

results.title: Children learning by experience
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, John Taylor and Realist Films
results.brief_description: This is a study of children as they go about absorbed in their own affairs, learning in their own way. As children grow, they learn both by experience and by imitation; parents and teachers have to decide when it is better to interfere and when it is better to let children find out for themselves in their own way. This film presents a number of situations in which children and their learning processes raise problems which parents and teachers encounter from day to day, and suggestions are made as to how these problems can be solved. This is one of a series of films which includes “Your children and you”, “Your children’s sleep”, “Your children’s meals” and “Children growing up with other people”.

results.title: Children learn from filmstrips
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Frank Spiller, Richard Gilbert and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Illustrates the value of audio-visual instruction in primary schools. Children learn naturally about a subject such as the owl through visual presentation. Filmstrips help bring the world into the class-room. Various techniques for their use are suggested; silent run through for review, or a few frames at a time can be shown followed by discussion. Exercises, compositions and projects can be set afterwards to help reinforce what the children have learned.

results.title: Children in the hospital
results.creator_credit: M D, Edward Mason and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Describes through the experience of two young girls, the methods used in the pediatrics department of Boston City Hospital to alleviate the psychological burden of hospitalisation. Shows the varied reaction of the children and demonstrates the importance of adult assistance in reducing the pain and the disturbing consequences of hospitalisation.
